intro: Dombeya loucoubensis, commonly known as the Cameroon dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Dombeya loucoubensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often found in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
